data.title: Our Team — Chattanooga House of Prayer
data.text:
Micki Ann Harris

Spiritual Formation Director

mickiann@chatthop.org

Micki Ann Harris is the Spiritual Formation Director at the Chattanooga House of Prayer in Tennessee. She is also a certified spiritual director. Her greatest joy and delight is witnessing others grow in wholeness and deep connection with God. Micki Ann has four amazing grown children and a super brag-worthy granddaughter. She is a lover of nature, reading, and when inspired - writing. If you can’t find Micki Ann - look outside - you are sure to spot her with a glass of iced chai in hand staring at something beautiful.

Adam Whitescarver

Executive Director

adam@chatthop.org

Adam Whitescarver works with ministry leaders from over 40 denominations in the Chattanooga area and beyond to equip churches to cultivate prayer and build unity. Through teaching, writing, and speaking, Adam reaches across ecumenical and cultural lines to help others develop vibrant, Scriptural prayer lives as a foundation for active faith. Since 2001, Adam has been in ministry and outreach, and he has produced and published Christian content for over 15 years. He and his wife, Stephanie, live in North Georgia with their four children.

Shane Selby

Creative Director

shane@chatthop.org

Chattanooga native Shane Selby has a heart for revival and longs to see the fulfillment of Revelation 22:17 – a generation of believers joining in as “the Spirit and the bride say come.” He and his wife, Makayla, co-founded their personal ministry, Eleventh Hour Worship in 2015. Shane feels a John the Baptist calling on his life – a calling to prepare the way and the Body of Christ for the return of Jesus through intimate worship and songwriting. He currently serves as a worship leader, musician, songwriter, graphic designer, and producer in many different capacities around the city. In addition to creative direction for the Chattanooga House of Prayer, Shane helps lead The Union community.

Danny Hesterly

Pray Chattanooga Director

danny@chatthop.org

Danny Hesterly originally hails from a small town in Southern Illinois, but has claimed Tennessee his home since 1999. If you have the opportunity to spend any amount of time with Danny, you’ll easily notice his genuine love for people. He values being present with others, helping students of all ages discover God’s path for their lives and is a master of having fun along the way. Whether it’s rainy or sunny you can almost guarantee to see Danny’s smile shine through. His optimism for adventure and love of life are contagious. Danny’s own unique path has given him a beautiful perspective on purpose, leadership and what it means to follow the Jesus Way. Danny and his wife, Erin, live in Chattanooga with their two kiddos who are growing up way too fast.

Jake Edgeman

Director of Operations

jake@chatthop.org

Jake Edgeman is a North Georgia native, currently residing in Ringgold, GA. He is married to Kristian Edgeman, and they have two kids, Ben and Ali. He has worked and been in ministry since 2009, with the majority of those years in Connections Ministry. He loves people and has devoted his life to loving them well! He graduated from Bryan College in 2011 with an Organizational Management degree, and from the Pentecostal Theological Seminary with a Master’s in Theological Studies in 2015. His favorite thing in the world is spending time with his family and creating experiences with them as often as possible.

Elise Brandon

Director of Development

elise@chatthop.org

Elise is a Chattanooga native. This city has not only been her physical birthplace, but the grounds for her spiritual growth and development. While attending college at UTC, during a campus ministry worship meeting she clearly received a call from God to, “equip the saints, prepare for battle, this generation needs to be ready.” Her passion to live out that calling over the last 10 years has been by serving through college campus ministry and discipleship, she now seeks to see how God would have her answer that call through ChattHOP. When Elise isn’t in the office she is often discovering obscure Christian artists, spending time at local coffee shops, studying God’s word at a coffee shop, meeting friends at coffee shops, sliding down cardboard hill with her daughter near a coffee shop, and many other things by or near a coffee shop!

Makayla McKibben-Selby

Office Administrator

admin@chatthop.org

Makayla has a deep passion for worship and songwriting - especially in the context of the end of the age. Her and her husband, Shane, co-founded their personal ministry, Eleventh Hour Worship in 2015. Makayla also feels a John the Baptist calling on her life – a calling to prepare the way and the Body of Christ for the return of Jesus. She finds deep joy and purpose in community and discipleship. Makayla is currently a worship leader at her home church, and co-producer for Eleventh Hour Worship tunes as well as her solo music. When music isn’t consuming her time, you will find her adventuring outside, teaching end times prophecy, or spending time with family.

Josh Gilbert

Union Community Coordinator

josh@chatthop.org

With 15 years of music and ministry experience, Josh Gilbert has served at multiple churches and denominations. He also has his own traveling music ministry and he and his band regularly tour the United States performing and sharing Jesus through music to a wide variety of audiences. Josh feels the call to mentor, pastor, and raise up creatives in our community. Josh was a key piece in the conception of The Union community in 2016 and has recently officially joined the staff.

Alan Keen

Union Community Coordinator

alan@chatthop.org

Alan Keen is a creative and worship Leader who loves guitars and leading Gods people in worship. A Colorado native he now lives in Chattanooga, TN with his wife April and two kids Ellsie and Elin. In his 30+ years experience in leading worship, he has lead for many denominations and also lead worship for festivals, Christian venues, and churches around the US. He is a songwritter who won the Covenant Award (Canada’s Dove Awards) with his friend and fellow writer Chris Bray. He enjoys being with his family and he has been a faithful and extreme fan of Newcastle United all his life and also loves Boca Juniors and Gremio FC. Viva Futbal!
